New Records: The New York Yankees are AL champions for the 41st time in franchise history.
Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a decisive home run in the 10th inning, securing the Yankees' victory.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a game-tying home run, earning him the ALCS MVP.
Carlos Rodón struck out six batters and walked one before being relieved.
The Yankees bullpen, including Mark Leiter Jr., Tim Hill, Jake Cousins, and Luke Weaver, held the Guardians scoreless in the later innings.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees' journey to the World Series started with a high-risk trade for Juan Soto.
The Yankees will face either the Dodgers or the Mets in the World Series.
The Yankees' bullpen performance was crucial in their victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game took place on a cold night in Cleveland.
The Yankees' last World Series appearance was in 2009.
